d.title: Sentry JS lazily-loadable loader doesn't work
d.body:
## Version Information

Version: 20.10.1

## Description

According to the documentation (https://docs.sentry.io/platforms/javascript/install/lazy-load-sentry/#sdk-version) Sentry offers a lightweight lazy-loadable version of the Sentry JS SDK which is a lot smaller than the default bundles.

I tried to use it, but when I open the script that's shown inside the "JavaScript Loader" input box as shown in the docs, the entire contents of the script look like this:

```
function _sentry_noopWarning() {
  console.warn("The Sentry loader you are trying to use isn't working anymore, check your configuration.");
}
var Sentry = {
    addBreadcrumb: _sentry_noopWarning,
    captureEvent: _sentry_noopWarning,
    captureException: _sentry_noopWarning,
    captureMessage: _sentry_noopWarning,
    configureScope: _sentry_noopWarning,
    forceLoad: _sentry_noopWarning,
    init: _sentry_noopWarning,
    onLoad: _sentry_noopWarning,
    showReportDialog: _sentry_noopWarning,
    withScope: _sentry_noopWarning,
};
_sentry_noopWarning();
```

I tried grep-ing through the Sentry source code about this, but I was only able to find the template that generates this script (https://github.com/getsentry/sentry/blob/master/src/sentry/templates/sentry/js-sdk-loader-noop.js.tmpl) and couldn't figure out further how does Sentry decide to show this broken version instead of the real script.

The documentation isn't helpful either.

## Steps to Reproduce

Install Sentry on-premises and check the JavaScript Loader, I guess.

## Logs

No logs

d.title: `Sentry.captureMessage` events have a wrong title different from the message
Regression on Sentry issue not triggering status sync to Jira issue.

labels.name: Sync: Jira
labels.description: Apply to auto-create a Jira shadow ticket

d.body:
### Environment

SaaS (https://sentry.io/)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Configure jira integration with status sync. 
2. Create/link a Sentry issue to a Jira issue.
3. Resolve the issue in Sentry
4. The resolution status is correctly synced to Jira.
5. Trigger a regression in the Sentry issue

### Expected Result

The status is synced to Jira

### Actual Result

The status is not sync.

This seems to be affecting one organisation as the steps to reproduce do not result in the same issue on my test org. Due possible PII, specific information is in the shadow Jira ticket.

### Product Area

Settings - Integrations

### Link

_No response_

### DSN

_No response_

### Version

_No response_

┆Issue is synchronized with this [Jira Improvement](https://getsentry.atlassian.net/browse/FEEDBACK-2187) by [Unito](https://www.unito.io)

d.title: Alerts on Number of Errors does not work
d.body: Hi, Our sentry version is 25.8.0. When We try to define an alert on Number of Errors, even the conditions are met(for testing we have set very basic level) , it does not trigger any alert. What possible reason may cause this? Does anyone faced same or similar case? Kind regards.

d.title: Trigger "The issue changes state from archived to escalating" not triggering alerts
d.body: ### Environment SaaS (https://sentry.io/) ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Create an alert rule with the trigger: The issue changes state from archived to escalating 2. Mark any issue as Archived until it happens 1 time(s) 3. Send a new event to the issue above 4. The issue is marked as escalating: Escalated by Sentry because 1 event happened ### Expected Result The escalated issue trigger the alert rule ### Actual Result The alert rule is not triggered. Alert rule settings: https://dev-curumas.sentry.io/issues/alerts/rules/notjava/15072297/details/?pageStatsPeriod=24h Issue activity: https://dev-curumas.sentry.io/issues/6808289920/activity/?project=5242419&query=&referrer=issue-stream ### Product Area Alerts ### Link _No response_ ### DSN _No response_ ### Version _No response_

d.title: Transaction Duration Metrics don't match Measurement Metrics

labels.name: Sync: Jira
labels.description: Apply to auto-create a Jira shadow ticket

d.body: ### Environment SaaS (https://sentry.io/) ### Steps to Reproduce Consider two transactions, one un-scoped and the other scoped. (Let's call them Transaction A and B). Transaction A's duration is added as a measurement to Transaction B because we'd like to just track the duration of this operation instead of using a transaction on it. The metrics don't seem to match and my question is whether they should or not. In the dashboard below the left panels are showing various functions on `transaction.duration` of Transaction A. The lowest panel is just a list of the duration. The panels on the right are showing the same functions but applied to a measurement sent with Transaction B (the scoped one). ### Expected Result I expect there's some interpolation going on in both cases, but I would expect the same results, given the same, small set of data. Should a percentile calculation done on a measurement be the same as a duration of the same amount? All durations are known and seem to both be in the data set. If there is some variance, what is the accuracy of it? e.g. +/- 1% ### Actual Result ### Product Area Dashboards ### Link _No response_ ### DSN _No response_ ### Version _No response_ ┆Issue is synchronized with this [Jira Improvement](https://getsentry.atlassian.net/browse/FEEDBACK-2144) by [Unito](https://www.unito.io)

I don’t know if it has anything to do with this. ### Expected Result - There shouldn't be any of these pointless Replays in existence right? ![image](https://github.com/getsentry/self-hosted/assets/67668275/257e586c-e5e8-4f90-8316-f0106ab320b1) ### Actual Result - There are no exceptions in console and network ![image](https://github.com/getsentry/self-hosted/assets/67668275/4a2cf41f-d902-4751-b368-90845b3d3c3a) ### Event ID _No response_

d.title: Fields are being data-scrubbed ([Filtered]) which I am unable to debug and redact myself
d.body:
### Environment

SaaS (https://sentry.io/)

### What are you trying to accomplish?

Some of my events are being logged in sentry with their values `[Filtered]` out.
I am trying to form my logging to anticipate the default data-scrubbing rules where appropriate.

I am looking to achieve this by redacting portions of messages myself.

### How are you getting stuck?

I am unable to work out why these fields are being filtered, and having the default data scrubbing rules applied to them.

The first message is an obfuscated stack trace, which should not contain anything reasonably sensitive, and It's hard for me to work out what I could redact myself before sending to Sentry in order to log the safe components of the message.

The second is a simple message logged as a non-fatal, with the words "token" and "account" in them. I can infer the presence of the word "token" may be tripping the data-scrubbing rules, but I am not sure.

Reading the docs: https://docs.sentry.io/product/data-management-settings/scrubbing/server-side-scrubbing/, it seems they incompletely list the default keywords (`token` is not listed there, for example), meaning it is intractable for developers to anticipate which words, when used in a trusted and sanitary context, may trip the data scrubber.

The following solutions would help me:
1. It would be convenient if the data scrubber, instead of printing the tag `[Filtered]` explained why the field was scrubbed.
2. It would be very helpful if, accessible via documentation, there was a complete record of the default scrubbing rules so log authors could author their logs to avoid tripping them, writing for example "error verifying user pa**word" or "error when attempting to verify user t*ken".

### Where in the product are you?

Issues

### Link

_No response_

### DSN

_No response_

### Version

_No response_

d.title: Jira integration issue
d.body: ### Environment self-hosted (https://develop.sentry.dev/self-hosted/) ### Version 22.12.0 ### Link _No response_ ### DSN _No response_ ### Steps to Reproduce As far as I know you don't support anymore jira plugin, but jira server integration. Unfortunately I can't use Jira Server Integration due to security policy of Jira Server in my company. I decided re-write jira plugin and get rid of jira's deprecated method createmeta as you did for jira integration. It works. But I have visual bug with fields "Affects version" and "Fix Version". When I select smth in dropdown list, it doesn't shown as selected, actually nothing happens. But issue will be created with selected item even if it's not displayed on the UI. Also seems multiple choice for these fields doesn't work. The question is do you have the same issue with Jira integration? or know how to fix this issue? ### Expected Result selected items are displayed correctly on the UI for fields "Affects version" and "Fix Version" ### Actual Result selected items are displayed as unselected on the UI but actually used when jira issue is being created.

d.title: Bug: failure_rate / failure_rate_if causes 500 errors on Insights (dataset=spans)
d.body:
### Environment

self-hosted (https://develop.sentry.dev/self-hosted/)

### Steps to Reproduce

### Summary

When calling the Organization Events API with dataset=spans and requesting the field:

```
failure_rate_if(is_transaction,equals,true)
```
(or implicitly: failure_rate())

the Sentry backend returns HTTP 500 Internal Server Error, and Snuba RPC logs show a corresponding 500 on EndpointTraceItemTable/v1.

Removing this single field makes the same query succeed (HTTP 200).
This affects the Insights Frontend and Insights Backend landing tables, breaking UI functionality.
This occurs on a fresh Sentry Self-Hosted 25.11.0 installation and also reproducible on production running the same version.

### Impact
- Insights → Frontend "Landing Table" fails to load
- Insights → Backend "Landing Table" fails to load

All queries including failure_rate_if(...) on dataset=spans reliably return 500
All other fields (tpm(), p50_if, performance_score, etc.) work normally
Removing only the failure-rate field makes the API return HTTP 200

### Steps to Reproduce





### Expected Result

✅ Working request (200)

```
GET /api/0/organizations/<org>/events/
  ?dataset=spans
  &field=is_starred_transaction
  &field=transaction
  &field=project
  &field=tpm()
  &field=p50_if(span.duration,is_transaction,equals,true)
  &field=p75_if(span.duration,is_transaction,equals,true)
  &field=p95_if(span.duration,is_transaction,equals,true)
  &field=failure_rate_if(is_transaction,equals,true)
  &field=performance_score(measurements.score.total)
  &field=count_unique(user)
  &field=sum_if(span.duration,is_transaction,equals,true)
  &query=(span.op:[ui.render,...] OR project.id:[2]) !span.op:http.server
  &statsPeriod=24h
  &sort=-sum_if(span.duration,is_transaction,equals,true)
  &referrer=api.insights.frontend.landing-table
```

Same request with only this field removed:

```
&field=failure_rate_if(is_transaction,equals,true)
```
returns 200

### Actual Result

❌ Failing request (500)

```
GET /api/0/organizations/<org>/events/
  ?dataset=spans
  &field=is_starred_transaction
  &field=transaction
  &field=project
  &field=tpm()
  &field=p50_if(span.duration,is_transaction,equals,true)
  &field=p75_if(span.duration,is_transaction,equals,true)
  &field=p95_if(span.duration,is_transaction,equals,true)
  &field=failure_rate_if(is_transaction,equals,true)
  &field=performance_score(measurements.score.total)
  &field=count_unique(user)
  &field=sum_if(span.duration,is_transaction,equals,true)
  &query=(span.op:[ui.render,...] OR project.id:[2]) !span.op:http.server
  &statsPeriod=24h
  &sort=-sum_if(span.duration,is_transaction,equals,true)
  &referrer=api.insights.frontend.landing-table
```

Returns:

```
500 Internal Server Error (Sentry backend)
```

and Snuba logs:

```
POST /rpc/EndpointTraceItemTable/v1 ... 500 ... referrer=api.insights.frontend.landing-table
```

### Product Area

Insights

### Link

_No response_

### DSN

_No response_

### Version

25.11.0

d.title: Session Replays Not Working for Front End Errors in AspNetCore
d.body:
### Environment

SaaS (https://sentry.io/)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new project in with visual studio as an AspNetCore Web App (Model-View-Controller):
![image](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry/assets/91646805/1d9796cc-d614-40a4-b581-77cbb75b0edc)

2. Should have the following folder structure:
![image](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry/assets/91646805/70dcd0c0-53fe-4549-84bb-4ae936d3a73b)

3. Create new project in Sentry with browser javascript:

![image](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry/assets/91646805/cce1cf5c-1d0d-4704-b5cf-6defeeef4c1a)

4. Add the following line of code to the header in the Views/Home/Shared/_Layout.cshtml file with the correct dsn number for that project:

![image](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry/assets/91646805/b10baeea-7042-43bd-8051-5722c3b80649)

5. Add the following line of code to the Views/Home/Privacy.cshtml file to trigger an error that is sent to sentry:

![image](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry/assets/91646805/39cb75e5-0ceb-48b5-8384-0b0c8a3d5e59)

6. Run the solution and click on the Privacy tab at the top and the error will be triggered and sent to the Sentry project:

![image](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry/assets/91646805/ad9ed1a9-723b-4aab-9ef4-890a7006f5a4)


### Expected Result

Since session replays are on by default with the loader script:

https://docs.sentry.io/platforms/javascript/install/loader/

This should trigger an Error with a session replay as we threw an error in the <script> tag and you will see this in the sentry project. However, this will not show up in the session replays for that specific error. Since the default is at session replays will trigger after every error it should show up in that issue:

![image](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry/assets/91646805/9a22b09e-97ab-4f50-9b8e-51da82b0c95b)

 After running it a few times however I do see a session replay in the normal replays but do not see any issues attached to that session replay.

### Actual Result

Should be seeing it in this tab of the issue since it is an error but I do not:

![image](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry/assets/91646805/da585d45-5576-48b0-9238-6e483a104c4d)


### Product Area

Replays

### Link

_No response_

### DSN

_No response_

### Version

_No response_

d.title: Fix obfuscation for DB on the main thread perf issues

labels.name: Scope: Backend
labels.description: Automatically applied to PRs that change backend components

d.body:
### Platform

iOS

### Installed

Swift Package Manager

### Version

8.8.0

### Steps to Reproduce

* Enable CoreData tracing
* Perform DB action on the main thread (to trigger a performance issue)

### Expected Result

* Look at performance trace created by performing DB work on the main thread (e.g. with SwiftUI) and see where the call originated from in my app

### Actual Result

* All calls in the call-stack are redacted; both system frameworks as well as in-app ones (my main app bundle)

### Are you willing to submit a PR?

_No response_

d.title: Microsoft teams option no showing for issue alerts

labels.name: Sync: Jira
labels.description: Apply to auto-create a Jira shadow ticket

d.body:
### Environment

SaaS (https://sentry.io/)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Install the microsoft teams as per: https://docs.sentry.io/organization/integrations/notification-incidents/msteams/
2. Create a new issue alert
3. Try to add action to send messages to Microsoft Teams integration

Troubleshooting actions taken:
- trying to reinstall the integration, same issue
- trying to refresh list of available integrations

issue was reported in an [internal ticket.](https://sentry.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/137272)

### Expected Result

The option "Send a Microsoft Teams notification" is shown in the list.

### Actual Result

No "Send a Microsoft Teams notification" option:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b4f9890f-698d-498f-a7a2-a171a5682bc1)

Refreshing the list does not solve the issue, the integration shows as disabled in the HTTP response
```
"label": "Send a notification to the {team} Team to {channel}",
"enabled": false,
```

 The option to send message to MSTeams is available on Metric alerts:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1ea48407-a1e6-442b-b05d-5c0763f16037)

### Product Area

Alerts

### Link

_No response_

### DSN

_No response_

### Version

_No response_
